content:
# After successfully harvesting 10 additional Coal, my updated inventory now includes:
# - 10 Coal
# - 10 Iron Ore
# - 5 Stone
# - 3 Iron Gear Wheels

# Now, I can proceed to smelt the 10 Iron Ore into Iron Plates using the Stone Furnace. 
# I will need to ensure that the furnace is fueled with Coal before starting the smelting process.

# Let's place the Stone Furnace and insert the Coal and Iron Ore for smelting.

# First, I will place the Stone Furnace at a suitable position, ensuring I have enough space for the furnace and the output.
furnace_position = Position(x=10, y=-10)  # Example position for the furnace.
furnace = place_entity(Prototype.StoneFurnace, position=furnace_position)

# Insert Coal into the furnace for fuel.
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, furnace, quantity=5)  # Insert 5 Coal for smelting.

# Now, insert the Iron Ore into the furnace for smelting.
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, furnace, quantity=10)  # Insert 10 Iron Ore.

# I will now wait for the smelting process to complete, checking the furnace inventory periodically.
for _ in range(30):  # Maximum 30 seconds wait
    if inspect_inventory(furnace)[Prototype.IronPlate] >= 10:
        break
    sleep(1)
else:
    raise Exception("Smelting timeout - check fuel and inputs")

# After smelting, I will check the inventory to see how many Iron Plates I have produced.
